fruits.title: Apple
fruits.description: Apples are a popular fruit that are high in Vitamin C and can be eaten fresh or used in cooking and baking.
fruits.soil: well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0 to 7.0
fruits.cultivation_process: Apple trees are typically propagated by grafting a desired variety onto a rootstock. The tree is then planted in a sunny location with well-drained soil and is trained and pruned to encourage fruiting.

fruits.title: Banana
fruits.description: Bananas are a tropical fruit that are high in potassium and can be eaten fresh or used in smoothies and baking.
fruits.soil: well-drained, rich soil with a pH of 6.0 to 7.0
fruits.cultivation_process: Banana plants are propagated by dividing the rhizomes or by using suckers. They are planted in a sunny location with well-drained soil and require consistent moisture and fertilization to produce fruit.

fruits.title: Cherry
fruits.description: Cherries are a sweet, juicy fruit that can be eaten fresh or used in cooking and baking. They are high in antioxidants.
fruits.soil: well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0 to 7.0
fruits.cultivation_process: Cherry trees are propagated by grafting a desired variety onto a rootstock. The tree is then planted in a sunny location with well-drained soil and is trained and pruned to encourage fruiting.

fruits.description: Pineapples are a tropical fruit that are high in Vitamin C and can be eaten fresh or used in cooking and baking.
fruits.soil: well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0 to 7.0
fruits.cultivation_process: Pineapple plants are propagated by using suckers or slips. They are planted in a sunny location with well-drained soil and require consistent moisture and fertilization to produce fruit.

fruits.cultivation_process: Watermelon plants are propagated by using seed. They are planted in a sunny location with well-drained soil and require consistent moisture and fertilization to produce fruit.

fruits.cultivation_process: Strawberry plants are propagated by using runners. They are planted in a sunny location with well-drained soil and require consistent moisture and fertilization to produce fruit.

fruits.title: Blueberry
fruits.description: Blueberries are a sweet fruit that are high in antioxidants and can be eaten fresh or used in cooking and baking.
fruits.soil: well-drained, acidic soil with a pH of 4.0 to 5.0
fruits.cultivation_process: Blueberry bushes are typically propagated by using cuttings or by layering. They are planted in a sunny location with well-drained, acidic soil and require consistent moisture and fertilization to produce fruit.

fruits.title: Tomatoes
fruits.description: Tomatoes are a warm-season vegetable that are commonly grown in gardens and on farms. They are a versatile ingredient that can be used in a variety of dishes, including salads, sandwiches, and sauces.
fruits.cultivation_process: Tomatoes should be planted in a sunny location after all danger of frost has passed. They should be spaced 18-24 inches apart and staked or caged for support. Tomatoes require regular watering and fertilization throughout the growing season.

fruits.title: Carrots
fruits.description: Carrots are a cool-season vegetable that are known for their sweet, crisp flavor. They are a popular ingredient in salads, soups, and roasted dishes.
fruits.cultivation_process: Carrots should be planted in a sunny location as soon as the soil can be worked in the spring. They should be spaced 2-3 inches apart and thinned to 3-4 inches apart when they are about 1 inch tall. Carrots require regular watering and fertilization throughout the growing season.
